intro: Chaetogastra campii, commonly known as the Camp's chaetogastra, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract various pollinators, including bees and birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
